You would not expect this thing:

```{python}
#| label: update-weird
#| fig-cap: "A line plot on a polar axis"

from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
prior = np.asarray([10, 2, 3, 3])
prior = prior / prior.sum()
update = np.asarray([0.9, 0.98, 0.97, 0.975])
k = np.arange(200)
unnorm = prior * np.power(update[None, :], k[:, None])
norm = unnorm / unnorm.sum(axis=-1, keepdims=True)
nll = -np.log(norm)
plt.plot(nll)
plt.xscale("log")
plt.yscale("log")
plt.xlabel("Time")
plt.ylabel("NLL")
plt.show()
```

This is it!
